thread.title: Florida firms see sales soar from Paris Air Show
thread.title_full: Florida firms see sales soar from Paris Air Show

author: Megan Ribbens
title: Florida firms see sales soar from Paris Air Show
text:
Florida firms see sales soar from Paris Air Show Jul 29, 2015, 6:05am EDT Industries & Tags Megan Ribbens Web Producer Orlando Business Journal Megan Ribbens Web Producer Orlando Business Journal Related Content Fabrice Dimier A model of a Dassault Aviation SA Falcon jet stands on display at the Paris Air Show. The Sunshine State took home a total of $151 million in total sales from the 2015 Paris Air Show, Gov. Rick Scott announced July 28. Seventeen companies from Florida attended the show, four of which were from Central Florida. The participating Florida companies and organizations included: Aerospace Precision, Hollywood Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University, Daytona Beach FLG Technics, Davie Florida Aeronautics Inc., Pompano Beach Future Metals, Tamarac Honeycomb Co. of America, Sarasota JBT AeroTech, Orlando Pan American Tools Corp., Fort Lauderdale Relli Technology, Boca Raton Team Volusia EDC, Daytona Beach The 2015 Paris Air Show was the largest in the eventâ€™s history, with more than 2,300 exhibitors from 48 countries and 351,000 visitors. The Sunshine State also was the largest state exhibitor at the event and had the largest presence of all exhibitors in the U.S. International Pavilion.
